summary: This bill, the United States-Taiwan Expedited Double-Tax Relief Act, aims to provide special tax rules for certain Taiwanese residents with income from U.S. sources. It amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to address taxation of interest, dividends, royalties, wages, and income from entertainment or athletic activities. The act also authorizes the President to negotiate and enter into a tax agreement with Taiwan regarding double taxation, subject to congressional approval and implementation.
